intro: Baeria affinis, commonly known as the small-leaved baeria, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators. Baeria affinis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
